like.issue: Often used in manipulative or hollow affirmations; lacks depth.

empower.issue: Implies top-down grant of agency; can obscure relational power.

resilience.issue: Can normalize trauma and overburden survivors with praise.

engage.issue: Corporate euphemism for control or attention extraction.

inspire.issue: Used performatively; often without substance or reciprocity.

care.issue: Common in institutional coercion or pacification speech.
